Material used.Description: Dermal fibroblasts were isolated from explanted patient's biopsy specimen.

Readout description.Result Description: No variation in mtDNA copy number was observed in patient's fibroblasts for the PINK1 mutation.
No variation in mtDNA copy number was observed in patient's fibroblasts for the ND5 mutation.
No variation in mtDNA copy number was observed in patient's fibroblasts for the ND6 mutation.

Basic positive control.Description: Adult normal human dermal fibroblasts (NHDF) were used as control.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Comparable mtDNA copy number to control (around 10^3 mtDNA copies/cell).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation from control mtDNA copy number.

Material used.Description: DNA extracted from patient's fibroblasts and blood sample for mtDNA sequencing.

Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 mutation was not directly assessed in mtDNA sequencing.
Homoplasmic mutation m.12397A>G (p.T21A) in ND5 gene detected in patient's fibroblasts and blood sample.
Homoplasmic mutation m.14319T>C (p.N119D) in ND6 gene detected in patient's fibroblasts and blood sample.

Biological replicates.Description: Confirmed in a different batch of originally isolated fibroblasts and blood sample.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No mutations or known polymorphisms compared to Cambridge sequence.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Presence of unreported single nucleotide changes resulting in amino acid substitution.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Enzymatic Assay for NADH:ubiquinone Oxidoreductase Activity

Material used.Description: Ultrasound treated fibroblasts suspended for enzymatic assay.

Readout description.Result Description: PINK1 mutation associated with altered enzymatic parameters in complex I.
ND5 mutation associated with almost fivefold decrease in apparent Km for substrates and 26% inhibition of Vmax with NADH.
ND6 mutation associated with almost fivefold decrease in apparent Km for substrates and 26% inhibition of Vmax with NADH.

Technical replicates.Description: Averages of two measurements at each substrate concentration.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Least square analysis of datasets for Lineweaver-Burk plots.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Enzymatic activity comparable to control fibroblasts (NHDF).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant decrease in Km or Vmax compared to control.

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Confocal Microscopy for Mitochondrial Superoxide Production

Material used.Description: Cells cultured at low density on fibronectin coated dishes.

Readout description.Result Description: Significant twofold increase in superoxide production in patient's fibroblasts with PINK1 mutation.
ND5 mutation associated with enhanced constitutive production of superoxide anion radical.
ND6 mutation associated with enhanced constitutive production of superoxide anion radical.

Basic negative control.Description: Pre-treatment with diphenyleneiodinium (DPI) to inhibit complex I.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Fluorescence intensity comparable to control fibroblasts (NHDF).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant increase in fluorescence intensity compared to control (twofold increase).

Experiment Method.Assay Method: Two-Dimensional Gel Analysis and Western Blotting

Material used.Description: Mitoplasts from NHDFs or patient's fibroblasts for gel analysis.

Readout description.Result Description: No detectable change in expression of oxidative phosphorylation complexes for PINK1 mutation.
No detectable change in expression of oxidative phosphorylation complexes for ND5 mutation.
No detectable change in expression of oxidative phosphorylation complexes for ND6 mutation.

Biological replicates.Description: Representative of three independent assays for gel analysis and repeated twice for western blotting.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Expression levels of OXPHOS complexes comparable to control fibroblasts (NHDF).

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation in expression levels of OXPHOS complexes compared to control.
